lines.text: Cheer up, Saunders. The operation's a success. And officially, its still yours.
I have no intention of leaving it at that, 007! I'm reporting to M that you deliberately missed. Your orders were to kill that sniper!

*Stuff* my orders! I only kill professionals. That girl didn't know one end of her rifle from the other. Go ahead. Tell M what you want. If he fires me, I'll thank him for it. Whoever she was, it must have scared the living daylights out of her.
What happened?
He got the boot.
[after demonstrating a boom-box rocket launcher]

[to Bond]
Something we're making for the Americans. It's called a "Ghetto Blaster".
[after escaping out of a small jail cell]
You were fantastic. We're free.
Kara, we're inside a Russian airbase in the middle of Afghanistan.
I've come for Koskov.
Hell, you can *have* him. As soon as I get my opium. Now where is it?
Up in smoke.

[incredulous]
You burned up a half a billion bucks?
[Bond nods]
That's too bad, Bond. You could've been a live rich man, instead of a poor dead one.
You're *finished*, Whitaker! If the Russians don't get you, the Americans will!
Nah. You know Meade should have taken another 35,000 casualties. Could have ended the rebellion right then and there. Hell, Grant would have done it.
[Whitaker manages to knock Bond off his feet, grab a machine gun and open fire on him]

[into phone]
It's all so boring here, Margo - there's nothing but playboys and tennis pros.
[sighs]
If only I could find a real man.
[James Bond, having just dispatched an assassin in a burning truck in mid-air, lands on the boat with a smoldering parachute]
I need to use your phone.
[takes it and says into it]
She'll call you back.
You are who?
Bond, James Bond.
[into phone]
Exercise Control, 007 here. I'll report in an hour.

[offering drink]
Won't you join me?

[into phone]
Better make that two.
[On Whitaker being crushed under a statue of the Duke of Wellington]
He met his Waterloo.
duty has no sweethearts.
We have an old saying too, Georgi. And you're full of it.

[Bond is pointing a gun at him]
Get down on your knees. Put your hands behind your back.
You are professional. You do not kill without reason.
2 of our men are dead. Koskov's named you. Why should I disobey my orders?
I am in the dark as much as you. It is a question of trust. Who do you believe? Koskov, or me?
If I trusted Koskov we wouldn't be talking. But as long as you're alive, we'll never know what he's up to.

[Slowly]
Then I must die.
[last lines]
You didn't think I'd miss this performance, did you?
[Bond kisses Kara passionately]
Oh, James!
Keep this between ourselves.
That girl must be very talented.
Believe me, my interest in her is purely professional.

[after destroying his car]
Glad I insisted you brought that cello.
Just taking the Aston out for a spin, Q.
Be careful, 007! It's just had a new coat of paint!
How do you like my personal pantheon of great commanders?
Butchers.
Surgeons. They cut away society's dead flesh.

[after Bond allegedly killed General Pushkin]
I didn't kill him. Bond did.
I told you the British believed me. I told you!

[a police car had been cut with a laser]
What happened?

[mockingly]
Salt corrosion.
[Referring to his machine gun vs Bond's hand gun]
You've had your eight, now I have my eighty.
[Bond finds Whitaker playing with toy soldiers]
Pickett's charge was up Cemetary Ridge, not Little Round Top.
I'm reenacting the battle as I would have fought it. Meade was tenacious, but he was cautious. He missed his chances to crush Lee at Gettsyburg.
[James Bond and Kara Milovy snow-slide through customs in a cello case]

[yelling]
We have nothing to declare.

[yelling]
Except this cello.
[the word 'cello' echoes through the valley a few times]
[struggling with Kara's cello]
Why didn't you learn the violin?
The sniper was a woman.
I noticed.
Some of the best KGB shots are women.
Um-hum.
Did you...
I'd rather not talk about it.

[thinking Bond killed her]
Oh, no. Of course not.
Lovely girl with the cello.
Forget the ladies for once, Bond.
Put him on the next plane to Moscow...
Oh, thank you General, thank you so much...
...in the diplomatic bag.

[in the Aston Martin]
I had a few optional extras installed.
Relax Georgi. Our engineers have spent months perfecting this.
How many times have you done this before?
You're the first!
Vienna's beautiful. Just like Georgi said.
You care for him a great deal, don't you?
I owe him everything. My scholarship at the Conservatoire. My Strad.
Your cello's a Stradivarius?
A famous one! The "Lady Rose". Georgi lived in New York.
Quite a present.
Maybe someday I'll play there. At Carnegie Hall? Georgi believes I can do it.
I'm sure he's right.

[Bond gets the drop on Pushkin]
I take this is not a social call, 007.
Correct.
[referring to flowers]
You should have brought lilies.
May I ask why?
Smiert Spionum.
Smiert Spionum? Was a Beria operation, in Stalin's time. It was deactivated 20 years ago.
Two of our men are dead.
My condolences. We had nothing to do with it.
[after successfully allowing Bond to get away by seducing the supervisor, she throws him off her]

[in Czech]
What kind of girl do you think I am?
[after removing his disguise]
Thank you both for your help. My name is Kamran Shah. Please forgive the theatricals, it's a hangover from my Oxford days.
You dumb, stupid, stubborn, zadnyaya chast' loshadi!
What's that supposed to mean?
Back end of horse!
Are you calling me a horse's arse?
[Bond and Saunders meet for the first time]
Saunders. Head of Section "V" Vienna. You're *bloody* late. This is a mission, not a fancy dress ball.
We have time.
[first lines]

Gentlemen, this may only be an exercise so far as the Ministry of Defence is concerned. But for me, it is a matter of pride that the 00 section has been chosen for this test. Your objective is to penetrate the radar installations of Gibralter. Now, the SAS has been placed on full alert to intercept you, but I know you won't let me down. Good luck, men.
[Bond and Saunders are discussing the change of plans on Koskov's defection]
James. James Bond!

[hugging Koskov]
Later, General!

[to Saunders]
Lose them. I'll pick you up at the border, twenty-three hundred hours. Be there.
Where are you taking him? How will you get him out?
Sorry, old man, section 26, paragraph 5. Need-to-know. Sure you understand.
Don't think. Just let it happen.
[Saunders has just been assassnated]
Did you hear?
Hear from Georgi?
Yes, I *got* the message.
Russkie. Has Colonel Feydor considered my appeal?
Yes. Good news. You won't be hung in the morning. You will be *shot*!
[laughs]
It's all a mistake. I stole *nothing*!
You can tell Allah. When you see him.
[laughs]

[seeing the Huey]
Who's that for?
You, Comrade!
[knocks him out with his gun]

[to third man present]
Help him or I'll kill you both!
I've been such a fool.

[grasping her hand and squeezing it]
We both have.
I'm posing as Koskov's friend to see what leads I can get from her. You know he bought her a cello in New York, called "The Lady Rose".
A cello with a name?
It's a Stradivarius.

[when Saunders looks none the wiser]
They *all* have names. Now where would Koskov get that kind of money? Check it out.
Remember, when this says 100, turn this. Not before.
[starts to leave]
Where are you going?
To take care of the supervisor. When pig goes, his control panel will light up like christmas tree.
I have not had a woman prisoner in a very long time...
[laughs]
Strip!
[Kara curses at him]
Shout all you want. It's soundproof. The Colonel does not like to hear screaming at night.
[Bond bends down to pick up his key ring; he hits Bond with a club]
I did not tell you to get down.
[Bond starts to rise, but he hits him again]
I did not tell you to get UP!
[beat]
NOW! Get up!

[referring to man who beats up another man]
Hope he's not invited to dinner.
Just what the hell are you trying to do, 007? Start World War III?
Felix Leiter. Now what's the CIA doing here?
Nice work girls.
No hard feelings?
Just as long as the party's still on.
[men threaten Bond and Kara]
[talks in different language]
What did you tell them?
I tell them you not Russian. They no kill you now.
Not now? How about later?
Una Yakov. Confirmed kills - 3. Probable kills - 2. Assassination methods - strangulation with hands or thighs.
Why, James, she's just your type.
Wrong again, Moneypenny. You are.
I'll file that with the other secret information around here.
Moneypenny, be a dear, ask Records to monitor Czech publications and news services, see if they can find any mention of a woman cellist at a Conservatoire in Bratislava.
I didn't know you were such a music lover, James. Anytime you want to drop by and listen to my Barry Manilow collection...
[Bond pats Moneypenny on the behind twice and leaves]
What's this? From Harrods - a godsend! The food here is horrible.
The foie gras is excellent.
Da-da-da. As Russians say, "Heart and stomachs, good comrades made." Head cheese, caviar, well that's peasant food for us, but, with champagne its okay. Bollinger R.D. - the best!
Once we were like brothers! But, now he's a different man. Power has gone to his head. He's sick like Stalin! He hates our new policy of Détente.
There are a few things I'd like to check out first, sir. That sniper, for instance.
Yes. I've read Saunders report. You jeopardized the entire mission to avoid shooting a beautiful girl.
Not exactly, sir. I took a split second decision. It was instinct.
Stun gas! Effective range - oh, about five feet. Disorientates any normal person for about - oh, 30 seconds.
You don't find too many normal people in this business, Q.
We packed the finder with a highly concentrated plastic explosive. Sufficient to remove a door of any safe. Its magnetic. The actuating signal is personalized.
What's my code?
a wolf whistle.
Just taking the Aston Martin out for a quick spin, Q.
Be careful, 007. Its just had a new coat of paint!
You're English. Who are you?
I heard you play at the Conservatoire yesterday. It was exquisite. I saw what happened on the Tram. Where'd they take you? KGB headquarters?

[Bond tuning the car radio]
You picked the police band?
It must be an atmospheric phenomenon.
They are looking for a foreign car. A man and a woman!
And a cello!

My hobby. The strategy and tactics of the world's historic battles. Afghanistan. The Northwest Frontier. 1895. The initial trial of the first automatic machine gun... 303 Caliber Maxim. The King's Royal Rifles - they whacked out a vastly superior force. Kept the British in Afghanistan for another 25 years. Now, what you Russians need over there, nowadays, is the equivalent of a modern Maxim.
Oh, Good afternoon Mr. Bond. You will need your usual suite?
Not tonight, Heinz. Something with a second bedroom.
Yes, sir. Shall I have some Vodka martinis sent up?
Shaken, not stirred.
Necros can do it.
I've worked with the Russians. My appearance and methods are well known to them. It could jeopardize my comrades struggling for world revolution who depend upon me.
Very well. I've got nothing to lose but my pension. Meet me at the Prater Cafe near the Ferris Wheel at midnight.

[to Bond]
Take me on the Wheel.
It was bought recently, at auction in New York. Lot 1-2-4, the "Lady Rose" a cello by Stradivarius of Cremona. 1724. Sold for $150,000 - to Brad Whitaker.
Whitaker? The arms dealer?
The same.
That was damn stupid!
She has so many talents!
Hey! You lookin' for a party?
Seems like a good idea.
[Bond gets in the car]
Welcome to Afghanistan.
Colonel Feyador, my old comrade in arms.
You will be shot!
[laughs]
It's all a mistake! I stole nothing!
You can tell Allah - when you see him!
[laughs]
It's the work of the Mujahideen.
Mujahideen?
The Afghan resistance.
I know a great restaurant in Karachi. We can just make dinner.
